node.title: Warner fit to play in Adelaide, Richardson locked in for Ashes berth
node.alt: David Warner stretches out his glutes on the ground at training
node.description: A rib injury will not keep David Warner from playing the second Ashes Test in Adelaide, while Jhye Richardson is confirmed to replace Josh Hazlewood in the bowling attack.
node.content:
["David Warner has been passed fit to play in the second Ashes Test in Adelaide despite a rib injury that kept him from the field for much of the first Test at the Gabba.", "Captain Pat Cummins confirmed the news on the eve of the Test at Adelaide Oval, while also locking in fast bowler Jhye Richardson as replacement for the injured Josh Hazlewood.", "Warner was struck in the ribs by a Ben Stokes delivery on day two in Brisbane\u00a0but batted on to score 94.", "He did not take the field with Australia on days three or four, and Alex Carey filled in for him at the top of Australia's batting order during the brief second-innings run chase.", "\"He will be right,\" Cummins said.", "\"He had a bat yesterday and batted in a bit of discomfort but he'll be fine.", "\"It's not an injury like a broken bone, but\u00a0he might be in a bit of discomfort. If he thought he couldn't be as good as he normally is, he wouldn't be playing.\"", "\"He'll be fine when the adrenaline kicks in. It's one thing batting in the nets, different thing with a packed crowd.", "\"He didn't have painkillers, he's played close to 90 Tests. I'm sure a lot of them have been played with discomfort or things going into the game.\"", "", "
Jhye Richardson will play his first Test since 2019 in Adelaide.(Getty Images: Mark Brake)
", "Warner has batted in the nets in the lead up to the Adelaide Test, but not without discomfort.", "Richardson's inclusion is the only change to the Australian team that won the first Test at the Gabba by nine wickets.", "The West Australian played two Tests for Australia in 2019 against Sri Lanka, and won the nod ahead of Queenslander Michael Neser, whose long wait for a Test debut continues.", "\"He swings the ball both ways, he's a bit faster than you think,\u00a0and he's really consistent,\" Cummins said.", "\"He's more than ready to go.\"", "Richardson has taken 23 Sheffield Shield wickets this season in just four matches, at an average of 13.43."]
